error.signature: interface conversion: interface is nil, not SomeType

verdict.summary: A type assertion was attempted on a nil interface value. The interface holds no concrete value, so the assertion panics at runtime.

dead_ends.action: Wrap the assertion in a recover() without fixing the root cause
dead_ends.why_fails: Masking panics hides the nil interface bug â€” the code path that should set the value is still broken

workarounds.action: Use the comma-ok idiom to safely check the assertion
Add a nil check before the type assertion

leads_to.condition: when the nil interface is used without assertion

preceded_by.condition: when fixing wrong-type assertion leads to nil-value assertion

frequently_confused_with.distinction: 'interface is nil, not' is a runtime panic from type-asserting a nil interface, while the nil-interface-not-nil bug is about an interface holding a nil concrete pointer appearing non-nil.
